Sentence.sentence: The findings caught Carli off guard.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The internet makes information billionaires out of all of us, and the architects of our online experiences are catching on to the need to make things creatively difficult
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Readers will feel they know John Muir after reading his story and may catch his passion for preserving the riches of our land.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Did you catch Professor Smith on TV last night
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Of course, you'll need some time to catch your breath every so often, but the essential massage is keep moving, extending and learning.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第一套）听力 Section B

Sentence.sentence: Researchers are already asking if motor vehicle use has reached its peak and will decline, but transport planners have yet to catch up with this trend, instead of laying new roads to tackle traffic jams.
Sentence.come: 2019年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: That suggests that catch - up sleep may undo some but not all of the damage that sleep 32 deprivation causes, which is encouraging, given how many adults don't get the hours they need each night.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section A

Sentence.sentence: Whether or not we can catch up on sleep — on the weekend, say — is a hotly debated topic among sleep researchers.
Sentence.come: 2015年12月六级真题（第二套）阅读 Section A

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词均有"抓住，捕捉"之意。
means: arrest ：指根据法律或命令进行逮捕并予以监禁或拘留。
capture ：指通过武力或计谋等，战胜抵抗而捉住敌人或动物。
catch ：普通用词，指捉住跑动或隐藏中的人或动物，一般指活捉。
seize ：侧重指以突然、有力地动作迅速抓住或捉住。

stems_affixes.value_cn: 捕获, 赶上, 发觉

word_mean: 在天然水域采捕的水生动物。

Sentence.sentence: A boy on a bike caught my attention.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷2 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: After climbing up a hill for a panoramic view of the blue sea, white buildings and green olive trees, I paused to catch my breath and then positioned myself to take the best photo of this panorama.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Also, don't wear loose clothes, long scarves, big necklaces, or loose belts — they get caught in something or fall into liquid.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷2 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: And that's precisely why one garbage-eating Frenchman has caught our attention.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语浙江卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Berger explains in his new book, "contagious: why things catch on."
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: But the only thing that wasn't very fun about it was that he could catch many fish while I couldn't catch anything.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: But the phrase "penny paper" caught the public's fancy, and soon there would be papers that did indeed sell for only a penny.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: Cafés focused around psychology, history, and engineering are catching on, filling tables well into the evening.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Failing to find any other way out, they decided to make a walking journey, as they caught sight of an old.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: Fourteen wolves were caught in Canada and transported to the park.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: He always answered, "Son, if you want to catch a fish, you have to think like a fish", I remember being even more upset then because, "I'm not a fish!" I didn't know how to think like a fish.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: He could not catch a fish.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读B 选项

Sentence.sentence: I had one trip last year where I was caught by a hurricane in America.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: I was watching the clock all through the meeting, as I had a train to catch.
Sentence.come: 2017年高考英语天津卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: If we had caught the flight yesterday, we would be enjoying our holiday on the beach now.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语天津卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: It forces fishermen to stop catching fish around Christmas.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读C 选项

Sentence.sentence: I've got to catch a bus.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷1 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: Melissa, his daughter, felt it more than worthwhile to save his music, to which she fell asleep catch night when she was young.
Sentence.come: 2019年高考英语江苏卷 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: My dad never once said, "if you want to catch a fish you need to think like a fisherman."
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语广东卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: Scott's last journey, completed as he lay in a tent dying of cold and hunger, caught the world's imagination, and a film made in his honor drew crowds.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷2 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

Sentence.sentence: Something on its cover caught her eye.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读A 选项

Sentence.sentence: The book caught the author's eye because it reminded him of his own dog.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读C 题设

Sentence.sentence: The competition organizer, Lady Tottington, hires Wallace and Gromit to catch the monster alive.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语上海卷 阅读理解 阅读B 原文

Sentence.sentence: The cover of a book caught my eye.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语天津卷 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The day itself is on October 21, but since it has caught on, events now spread out over most of October around Britain.
Sentence.come: 2016年高考英语全国卷3 阅读理解 阅读C 原文

Sentence.sentence: The river was so polluted that it actually caught fire and burned.
Sentence.come: 2014年高考英语全国卷1 语法填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: To avoid being caught, the Winns had to get their tent up late.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: To catch the early flight, we ordered a taxi in advance and got up very early.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语北京卷 单项填空 原文

Sentence.sentence: You go ahead, and I'll catch up on some sports news while waiting.
Sentence.come: 2018年高考英语全国卷3 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: You'd better hurry, or you won't be able to catch it.
Sentence.come: 2015年高考英语安徽卷 听力 原文

Sentence.sentence: Our main end was to catch fish.
Sentence.come: 出自-2009年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Yet two years before Dicken’s birth, his mother’s father was caught stealing and fled to Europe, never to return.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: First two hours , now three hours—this is how far in advance authorities are recommending people show up to catch a domestic flight , at least at some major U.airports with increasingly massive security lines.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年考研阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: "Our main end was to catch fish. "
Sentence.come: 2009年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: first two hours, now three hours一this is how far in advance authorities are recommending people show up to catch a domestic flight, at least at some major U.S. airports with increasingly massive security lines.
Sentence.come: 2017年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: It can catch someone's attention in a crowded room, "eye contact and smile" can signal availability and confidence, a common-sense notion supported in studies by psychologist Monica Moore.
Sentence.come: 2020年考研真题（英语一）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

Sentence.sentence: The research of till Von Wachter, the economist in Columbia University, suggests that not all people graduating into a recession see their life chances dimmed: those with degrees from elite universities catch up fairly quickly to where they otherwise woul
Sentence.come: 2012年考研真题（英语二）阅读理解 Section Ⅱ

sentences.en: I threw the ball to him and he caught it.
sentences.cn: 我将球扔给他, 他接住了。

means.word_mean: 逮住, 捉住, 抓住

sentences.en: I caught him by the arm.
sentences.cn: 我抓住他的胳膊。

means.word_mean: 偶然撞见, 突然发觉

sentences.en: He caught the boys stealing apples from his garden.
sentences.cn: 他撞上那些男孩子在他的花园里偷苹果。

sentences.en: They ran as fast as they could to catch the bus.
sentences.cn: 他们飞速奔跑去赶公共汽车。

means.word_mean: 理解, 听懂, 听到

sentences.en: Could you catch her meaning?
sentences.cn: 你明白她的意思吗?

sentences.en: I could hardly catch what he meant.
sentences.cn: 我简直不理解他说的意思。

sentences.en: The unusual paneling on the walls caught our attention.
sentences.cn: 墙上不寻常的镶板引起了我们的注意。

sentences.en: The bolt doesn't catch.
sentences.cn: 这门闩闩不住了。

sentences.en: Jim failed to hold a catch at cricket.
sentences.cn: 吉姆打板球时有一个球没有接住。

sentences.en: The catch on this door is broken.
sentences.cn: 这扇门上的吊扣坏了。

means.word_mean: 隐藏的困难；暗藏的不利因素
理想的对象；意中人；雇用的好对象；看中的人

sentences.en: He caught at the chance.
sentences.cn: 他急忙抓住这个机会。

sentences.en: The match caught instantly.
sentences.cn: 火柴立刻燃着。

sentences.en: He caught for the entire game.
sentences.cn: 在整个棒球比赛中都是由他充当接球手。

means.word_mean: 迷惑人的，令人容易上当的
引人注目的，吸引人的；令人感兴趣的</seg>

data.mean: 赶上（公共汽车、火车、飞机等）
引起，激发（兴趣、想象、注意等）
catch on 受欢迎；流行起来；变得时髦
be/get caught up in sth 被卷入；陷入
catch up on sth 了解（已发生的事情）
catch up on sth 补做（未做的事）；赶做；补上
catch up (with sb) 赶上，追上（某人）
catch sb's eye 引起某人注意；惹人注目
catch your death (of cold) 患重感冒
catch your breath （跑或激烈运动后）喘口气

sentence.en: To avoid being caught,  the Winns had to get their tent up late.
sentence.from: 2018年高考英语江苏卷 完形填空 原文

sentence.cn: 不过，唯一需要的部件是一张5英尺5英寸的透明或略带乳白色的塑料板、6英尺长的塑料管和一个容器——也许只是一个饮水杯——来接水。
sentence.en: The only components required,  though,  are a 5'5' sheet of clear or slightly milky plastic,  six feet of plastic tube,  and a container— perhaps just a drinking cup — to catch the water.
sentence.from: 2017年高考英语全国卷1 阅读理解 阅读D 原文

expand_knowledge_list.cn: 引人注意的；容易记住的

lj.lj_ls: 滑板运动很快就流行起来

jx.jx_en_mean: To detect (another) in the act or process of wrongdoing.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 侦测错误：侦测（另一人）正在犯错的行为或过程

lj.lj_ly: The mugger caught the wallet up and fled.
lj.lj_ls: 匪徒抢了钱夹并逃走了

jx.jx_en_mean: To detect (another) in a mistake or wrongdoing
jx.jx_cn_mean: 指出错误，指出差错：指出（另一人）错误或差错

lj.lj_ly: Auditors caught up with the embezzler.
lj.lj_ls: 查帐员查出了那个侵占公款者

jx.jx_en_mean: To come up from behind; overtake.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 超过：从后面赶上来；超过

jx.jx_en_mean: To become involved with, often unwillingly

lj.lj_ly: was caught up in the scandal.
I was caught up in the mood of the evening.
lj.lj_ls: 我沉醉在夜晚的情调中

jx.jx_en_mean: To bring up to date; brief
jx.jx_cn_mean: 使接近：将一项工作引向接近完成

lj.lj_ly: Let me catch you up on all the gossip.
lj.lj_ls: 让我把所有的流言蜚语简要地说给你

lj.lj_ly: I must catch up on my correspondence.
lj.lj_ls: 我必须尽快写完我的回信

jx.jx_en_mean: draw one's breath in sharply as a reaction to an emotion

lj.lj_ly: a vase on a side table caught his eye.
lj.lj_ls: 墙边桌上的一个花瓶吸引了他的视线。

jx.jx_en_mean: attract someone's attention by making eye contact with them

lj.lj_ly: he caught Eva's eye and beckoned.
lj.lj_ls: 他捕捉到伊娃的眼神，并向她示意。

jx.jx_en_mean: shine or glint in the light

entry.def: If you catch a person or animal, you capture them after chasing them, or by using a trap, net, or other device.

example.ex: Police say they are confident of catching the gunman...
example.tran: 警方说他们有信心抓住那个持枪歹徒。

example.ex: Where did you catch the fish?...
example.tran: 这条鱼你在哪儿逮的？

entry.def: If you catch an object that is moving through the air, you seize it with your hands.

example.ex: I jumped up to catch a ball and fell over.
example.tran: 我跳起来接球，结果摔了个跟头。

entry.def: If you catch a part of someone's body, you take or seize it with your hand, often in order to stop them going somewhere.

example.ex: Liz caught his arm...
example.tran: 莉兹一把抓住了他的胳膊。

example.ex: He knelt beside her and caught her hand in both of his...
example.tran: 他跪在她的旁边，双手握住她的一只手。

entry.def: If one thing catches another, it hits it accidentally or manages to hit it.

example.ex: The stinging slap almost caught his face...
example.tran: 那狠狠的一巴掌差点搧在他脸上。

example.ex: I may have caught him with my elbow but it was just an accident...
example.tran: 也许我的胳膊肘碰到了他，但那是无意的。

entry.def: If something catches on or in an object or if an object catches something, it accidentally becomes attached to the object or stuck in it.

example.ex: Her ankle caught on a root, and she almost lost her balance...
example.tran: 她的脚踝被树根绊了一下，差点摔倒。

example.ex: A man caught his foot in the lawnmower.
example.tran: 有个男的一只脚绞进剪草机里了。

entry.def: When you catch a bus, train, or plane, you get on it in order to travel somewhere.

example.ex: We were in plenty of time for Anthony to catch the ferry...
example.tran: 我们时间充裕得很，足够安东尼赶上渡船。

example.ex: He caught a taxi to Harrods.
example.tran: 他打了辆出租车去哈罗德百货商店。

entry.def: If you catch someone doing something wrong, you see or find them doing it.
entry.tran: 撞见，当场抓住(某人做坏事)

example.ex: He caught a youth breaking into a car...
example.tran: 他撞见一个青年正在撬车。

example.ex: I don't want to catch you pushing yourself into the picture to get some personal publicity...
example.tran: 我不希望看见你为了出风头而去抢镜头。

entry.def: If you catch yourself doing something, especially something surprising, you suddenly become aware that you are doing it.

example.ex: I caught myself feeling almost sorry for poor Mr Laurence.
example.tran: 我突然发觉自己几乎同情起可怜的劳伦斯先生来了。

entry.def: If you catch something or catch a glimpse of it, you notice it or manage to see it briefly.

example.ex: As she turned back she caught the puzzled look on her mother's face...
example.tran: 她转过身来，看见母亲脸上迷惑的表情。

example.ex: He caught a glimpse of the man's face in a shop window.
example.tran: 他在商店橱窗里瞥见了一眼那个人的脸。

entry.def: If you catch something that someone has said, you manage to hear it.

example.ex: His ears caught a faint cry...
example.tran: 他听到一声微弱的叫声。

example.ex: I do not believe I caught your name...
example.tran: 我没有听清你的名字。

entry.def: If you catch a TV or radio programme or an event, you manage to see or listen to it.
entry.tran: 观看，收看，收听(电视或电台节目)

example.ex: Bill turns on the radio to catch the local news...
example.tran: 比尔打开收音机，收听本地新闻。

example.ex: The exhibition is on at Droitwich until May 24. You can also catch it at Leominster from June 5.
example.tran: 展览在德罗伊特威奇一直持续到5月24日。从6月5日起，还可以在莱姆斯特参观该展览。

entry.def: If you catch someone, you manage to contact or meet them to talk to them, especially when they are just about to go somewhere else.

example.ex: I dialled Elizabeth's number thinking I might catch her before she left for work...
example.tran: 我拨了伊丽莎白的号码，心里想或许能赶在她去上班前联系到她。

example.ex: Hello, Dolph. Glad I caught you.
example.tran: 喂，多尔夫，可见着你了。

entry.def: If something or someone catches you by surprise or at a bad time, you were not expecting them or do not feel able to deal with them.
entry.tran: 使惊慌失措;使措手不及

example.ex: She looked as if the photographer had caught her by surprise...
example.tran: 看上去，她好像被摄影师搞了个猝不及防。

example.ex: I'm sorry but I just cannot say anything. You've caught me at a bad time...
example.tran: 对不起，我真的没什么好说的。你问得不是时候。

entry.def: If something catches your attention or your eye, you notice it or become interested in it.

example.ex: My shoes caught his attention...
example.tran: 我的鞋子引起了他的注意。

example.ex: A quick movement across the aisle caught his eye.
example.tran: 有个人影在走道里一闪而过，引起了他的注意。

entry.def: If someone or something catches a mood or an atmosphere, they successfully represent it or reflect it.

example.ex: There's no doubt Mr Putin's speech caught the mood of most deputies.
example.tran: 无疑，普金先生的讲话充分反映了大多数代表的心情。

entry.def: If you are caught in a storm or other unpleasant situation, it happens when you cannot avoid its effects.

example.ex: When he was fishing off the island he was caught in a storm and almost drowned...
example.tran: 他出岛捕鱼时，赶上一场暴风雨，差点淹死。

example.ex: Visitors to the area were caught between police and the rioters.
example.tran: 到该地区游玩的人碰上警察和骚乱分子交战。

entry.def: If you are caught between two alternatives or two people, you do not know which one to choose or follow.
entry.tran: (在两难中)不知如何选择，不知所措

example.ex: The Jordanian leader is caught between both sides in the dispute...
example.tran: 争论双方使约旦领导人左右为难。

example.ex: She was caught between envy and admiration.
example.tran: 她不知是该妒忌还是该羡慕。

entry.def: If you catch a cold or a disease, you become ill with it.

example.ex: The more stress you are under, the more likely you are to catch a cold.
example.tran: 压力越大，越有可能患感冒。

entry.def: To catch liquids or small pieces that fall from somewhere means to collect them in a container.

example.ex: The fish is laid out on a large serving plate to catch the juices.
example.tran: 鱼盛在一个大盘子里，以防汤汁洒出来。

example.ex: ...a specially designed breadboard with a tray to catch the crumbs.
example.tran: 特制的切面包板，有个能接住面包屑的槽

entry.def: If something catches the light or if the light catches it, it reflects the light and looks bright or shiny.

example.ex: They saw the ship's guns, catching the light of the moon...
example.tran: 他们看到船上的大炮在月光下熠熠生辉。

entry.def: If the wind or water catches something, it carries or pushes it along.

example.ex: A gust of wind caught the parachute.
example.tran: 一阵风将降落伞吹远。

entry.def: A catch on a window, door, or container is a device that fastens it.

example.ex: She fiddled with the catch of her bag...
example.tran: 她摆弄着包上的搭扣。

example.ex: Fit windows with safety locks or catches.
example.tran: 给窗户装上安全锁或窗栓。

entry.def: A catch is a hidden problem or difficulty in a plan or an offer that seems surprisingly good.

example.ex: The catch is that you work for your supper, and the food and accommodation can be very basic...
example.tran: 圈套在于你是在挣钱糊口，但食宿其实有可能非常简单。

example.ex: 'It's your money. You deserve it.' — 'What's the catch?'
example.tran: “这钱归你，你该拿这个钱。”——“搞什么名堂？”

entry.def: When people have been fishing, their catch is the total number of fish that they have caught.

example.ex: The catch included one fish over 18 pounds.
example.tran: 捕获的鱼里有一条重逾18磅。

entry.def: If you describe someone as a good catch, you mean that they have lots of good qualities and you think their partner or employer is very lucky to have found them.

example.ex: I was so in love with him and all my friends said what a good catch he was.
example.tran: 我当时和他陷入热恋，我的朋友们都说能找到他是我的福气。

entry.def: Catch is a game in which children throw a ball to each other.
Catch is a game in which one child chases other children and tries to touch or catch one of them.
You can say things such as 'You wouldn't catch me doing that' to emphasize that you would never do a particular thing.

example.ex: You won't catch me giving him a bad review!...
example.tran: 我绝不会说他坏话的。

example.ex: You wouldn't catch me in there, I can tell you.
example.tran: 我可以告诉你，你永远别想在那里看见我。

entry.def: If someone is caught with their pants down, something happens that they are not prepared for and that reveals something embarrassing or shocking about them. In British English, you can also say that they are caught with their trousers down .
entry.tran: 使猝不及防；使极其尴尬;使突陷窘境

example.ex: It makes soldiers happy to know that somebody right at the top has been caught with his trousers down...
example.tran: 顶头上司出了大洋相，当兵的最高兴了。

example.ex: I think we caught them with their pants down. They're a bit confused.
example.tran: 我觉得我们让他们下不了台了。他们有点不知所措。

sentences.sentence: "it sounds good but what's the catch?"

means.word_mean: 3. a person regarded as a good matrimonial prospect
4. anything that is caught (especially if it is worth catching);

sentences.sentence: "he shared his catch with the others"

means.word_mean: 5. a break or check in the voice (usually a sign of strong emotion)
6. a restraint that checks the motion of something;

sentences.sentence: "he used a book as a stop to hold the door open"

means.word_mean: 7. a fastener that fastens or locks a door or window
8. a cooperative game in which a ball is passed back and forth;

sentences.sentence: "he played catch with his son in the backyard"

means.word_mean: 9. the act of catching an object with the hands;

sentences.sentence: "Mays made the catch with his back to the plate"
"he made a grab for the ball before it landed"
"Martin's snatch at the bridle failed and the horse raced away"
"the infielder's snap and throw was a single motion"

means.word_mean: 10. the act of apprehending (especially apprehending a criminal);

sentences.sentence: "the policeman on the beat got credit for the collar"

means.word_mean: 1. discover or come upon accidentally, suddenly, or unexpectedly; catch somebody doing something or in a certain state;
2. perceive with the senses quickly, suddenly, or momentarily;

sentences.sentence: "He caught the allusion in her glance"

means.word_mean: 3. reach with a blow or hit in a particular spot;

sentences.sentence: "the rock caught her in the back of the head"
"The blow got him in the back"
"The punch caught him in the stomach"

means.word_mean: 4. take hold of so as to seize or restrain or stop the motion of;
5. succeed in catching or seizing, especially after a chase;
8. capture as if by hunting, snaring, or trapping;

sentences.sentence: "I caught a rabbit in the trap toady"
"I have to catch a train at 7 o'clock"

means.word_mean: 10. get or regain something necessary, usually quickly or briefly;
11. catch up with and possibly overtake;

sentences.sentence: "The Rolls Royce caught us near the exit ramp"
"She managed to catch herself before telling her boss what was on her mind"

means.word_mean: 14. hear, usually without the knowledge of the speakers;

sentences.sentence: "We overheard the conversation at the next table"
"This program will be seen all over the world"

means.word_mean: 16. cause to become accidentally or suddenly caught, ensnared, or entangled;

sentences.sentence: "I caught the hem of my dress in the brambles"

means.word_mean: 18. grasp with the mind or develop an undersatnding of;

sentences.sentence: "We caught something of his theory in the lecture"
"She didn't get his name when they met the first time"
"She will catch hell for this behavior!"
"She really caught the spirit of the place in her drawings"
"She got the mood just right in her photographs"
"We have a big barrel to catch the rainwater"
"he caught her staring out the window"

means.word_mean: 29. delay or hold up; prevent from proceeding on schedule or as planned;

sentences.sentence: "I was caught in traffic and missed the meeting"

derivation.yuyuan_name: Middle English (also in the sense 'chase'): from Anglo-Norman French and Old Northern French cachier, variant of Old French chacier, based on Latin captare 'try to catch', from capere 'take'

means: child and adolescent trial for cardiovascular health 儿童和青少年的心血管健康试验
community access to child health 儿童健康社区访问
character allocated transfer channel 字符分配传送通道
Citizens Against The Concorde Here 反对协和式飞机的公民

sentences.cn: 他出岛捕鱼时，赶上一场暴风雨，差点淹死。
sentences.en: When he was fishing off the island he was caught in a storm and almost drowned...

sentences.en: Visitors to the area were caught between police and the rioters.

sentences.cn: 争论双方使约旦领导人左右为难。
sentences.en: The Jordanian leader is caught between both sides in the dispute...

sentences.cn: 我拨了伊丽莎白的号码，心里想或许能赶在她去上班前联系到她。
sentences.en: I dialled Elizabeth's number thinking I might catch her before she left for work...

sentences.cn: 喂，多尔夫，可见着你了。
sentences.en: Hello, Dolph. Glad I caught you.

sentences.cn: 看上去，她好像被摄影师搞了个猝不及防。
sentences.en: She looked as if the photographer had caught her by surprise...

sentences.cn: 对不起，我真的没什么好说的。你问得不是时候。
sentences.en: I'm sorry but I just cannot say anything. You've caught me at a bad time...

sentences.en: There's no doubt Mr Putin's speech caught the mood of most deputies.

sentences.cn: 他听到一声微弱的叫声。
sentences.en: His ears caught a faint cry...

sentences.cn: 我没有听清你的名字。
sentences.en: I do not believe I caught your name...

sentences.cn: 比尔打开收音机，收听本地新闻。
sentences.en: Bill turns on the radio to catch the local news...

sentences.en: The exhibition is on at Droitwich until May 24. You can also catch it at Leominster from June 5.

sentences.en: He caught a youth breaking into a car...

sentences.en: I don't want to catch you pushing yourself into the picture to get some personal publicity...

sentences.en: I caught myself feeling almost sorry for poor Mr Laurence.

sentences.cn: 她转过身来，看见母亲脸上迷惑的表情。
sentences.en: As she turned back she caught the puzzled look on her mother's face...

sentences.en: Police say they are confident of catching the gunman...

sentences.en: Where did you catch the fish?...

sentences.en: I jumped up to catch a ball and fell over.

sentences.en: He knelt beside her and caught her hand in both of his...

sentences.cn: 那狠狠的一巴掌差点搧在他脸上。
sentences.en: The stinging slap almost caught his face...

sentences.cn: 也许我的胳膊肘碰到了他，但那是无意的。
sentences.en: I may have caught him with my elbow but it was just an accident...

sentences.en: Her ankle caught on a root, and she almost lost her balance...

sentences.en: A man caught his foot in the lawnmower.

sentences.en: We were in plenty of time for Anthony to catch the ferry...

sentences.en: He caught a taxi to Harrods.

sentences.en: Go on ahead. I'll catch up with you.

sentences.en: After missing a term through illness he had to work hard to catch up with the others.

sentences.en: We caught the 12.15 from Oxford.

sentences.en: Let's eat now and maybe we could catch a movie later.

sentences.cn: 我本希望赶上你在家的时候给你打电话。
sentences.en: I was hoping to catch you at home (= to telephone you at home when you were there) .

sentences.en: (British English)to catch the post (= post letters before the box is emptied)

sentences.en: Ferns sneakers sopping by the time she caught up with her father.

sentences.cn: 我赶上了倾盆大雨.
sentences.en: I was caught in a downpour.

sentences.cn: 他要是快点能够赶上头班公共汽车.
sentences.en: If he hurried, he could catch the first bus.

sentences.cn: 我们还有一小时的充裕时间搭 [ 赶上 ] 那班快车.
sentences.en: We have an hour's leeway to catch [ make ] the express.

sentences.cn: 他全速奔跑以赶上公共汽车.
sentences.en: He put on a sprint to catch the bus.

sentences.cn: 大雨赶上了他们,而且不一会就把他们淋得透湿.
sentences.en: The curtain of rain caught them up and in a moment soaked them to the skin.

sentences.cn: 我该走了--我得赶上公共汽车.
sentences.en: I must go I have a bus to catch.

sentences.cn: 他们凑巧能赶上最后一趟车.
sentences.en: As chance would have it they caught the last bus.

sentences.cn: 我们决心要赶上发达国家.
sentences.en: We are determined to catch up with the developed countries.

sentences.cn: 如果你早点起床, 你就会赶上火车了.
sentences.en: If you had got up earlier, you would have caught the train.

sentences.cn: 那辆劳斯莱斯在出口的斜坡附近赶上了我们.
sentences.en: The Rolls Royce caught us near the exit ramp.

sentences.cn: 我们正在努力工作,以赶上世界先进水平.
sentences.en: We are working hard to catch up with the advanced world levels.

sentences.cn: 到1971年,苏联人赶上了我们.
sentences.en: By 1971 the Soviets had caught up with us.

sentences.cn: 他赶上了上行的火车.
sentences.en: He caught the up train.

sentences.cn: 汤姆赶上来了, 现在与伊恩不相上下了.
sentences.en: Tom catches up. Now he is even with Ian.

sentences.cn: 藉著公主的帐户, 他每天花费了长人睡觉和赶上他的漫画.
sentences.en: By Princess's accounts, he spent the long days sleeping and catching up on his comic books.

sentences.cn: 她接住了落下的钥匙。
sentences.en: She managed to catch the keys as they fell.

sentences.cn: “请你把毛巾扔过来好吗？”“好，接住！”
sentences.en: ‘Throw me over that towel, will you? ’ ‘OK. Catch! ’

sentences.en: I throw a ball to her and she catch it.

sentences.en: She fainted and before she hit the ground, George jumped out from nowhere and caught her.

sentences.en: He caught the ball, then It'slipped through his fingers.

sentences.cn: 他把球抛起来,然后,又把它接住.
sentences.en: He threw the ball up and caught it.

sentences.cn: 当角球开进来时, 他亦威严地把球接住.
sentences.en: When the corner came in, he caught it majestically.

sentences.cn: 他向前一纵,就把球接住了.
sentences.en: He leaped forward and caught the ball.

sentences.cn: 这个婴儿喜欢被抛起来再被稳稳地接住.
sentences.en: The baby loved being thrown up into the air and safely caught again.

sentences.cn: 漏接没能接住 ( 传球 )
sentences.en: To fail to make ( a catch ).

sentences.cn: 那女孩试图接住那个球,便把胳膊伸了出去.
sentences.en: The girl's arms were outstretched as she tried to catch the ball.

sentences.cn: 出于本能. 那猴子在半空中接住了树枝.回到它自己那里去了.
sentences.en: By instinct. the monkey quickly caught hold of a branch halfway and back to his place.

sentences.en: Jim failed to hold a catch at cricket.

sentences.cn: 他往上一蹿,把球接住.
sentences.en: He leapt up and caught the ball.

sentences.en: Two of the team were caught out in the first innings.

sentences.en: She threw the ball and I caught it.

sentences.cn: 马克斯接住了球.
sentences.en: Max catches the ball.

sentences.en: The ball was caught by a fielder standing just inside the boundary.

sentences.cn: 要把球接住,不要让它落地.
sentences.en: Try to catch the ball before it lands.

sentences.en: Jimmy, catch the ball.

sentences.en: A foul ball was easily caught by the catcher.

sentences.cn: 那个作业员可望从上面接住那件货物.
sentences.en: The workman will catch the package from above.

sentences.cn: 然后她开始往空中抛金球, 再把它接住.
sentences.en: Then she began to toss a golden ball in the air, and catch it.

sentences.en: Can you catch the ball?

sentences.en: Fry pancake, toss the pancake, catch it if you can.

sentences.en: As soon as you've caught it, bring the ball quickly into the safety of your body.

sentences.cn: 你能引起服务员的注意吗？

sentences.en: Then, catching her hand, Mark drew her close, relishing the feeling of her in his arms.

sentences.en: The key thing is to catch the bar worker's eyes.

sentences.en: I knocked on the window to catch her attention.

sentences.en: Something caught my eye and I stooped to pick up a single , perfect red leaf.

sentences.cn: 窗户的陈设引起她的注意.

sentences.en: Hazardous materials transportation management has caught more and more attention of the society and the government.

sentences.en: I couldn't catch her eye.

sentences.cn: 我在文章中的习惯用语下面划了线,以便引起你的注意.
sentences.en: I underlined the idiomatic expressions in the passage to catch your eye.

sentences.cn: 他阐述的鲜明格言引起了人们的注意.
sentences.en: He formulated trenchant aphorisms that caught their attention.

sentences.cn: 现在, 一那些真的引起他的注意, 在中央的这里中的这一个.
sentences.en: Now, one of those really caught his eye, this one in the middle here.

sentences.cn: 我想再来一杯, 想引起服务员的注意.
sentences.en: I'd like another drink, try to catch the waiter's eye.

sentences.en: A trap can be used to call operating system routines or to catch arithmetic errors.

sentences.cn: 这里的危机引起了全世界的注意.
sentences.en: The crisis here caught the global attention.

sentences.cn: 远处的一个穹顶状物引起了他们的注意.
sentences.en: A cupola in the distance caught their attention.

sentences.cn: 裙子的精致和柔软引起了她的注意.
sentences.en: The fineness and softness of the dress caught her attention.

sentences.cn: 突然, 花园里的花引起了他的注意.
sentences.en: Suddenly, the flowers in the garden caught his eyes.

sentences.cn: 哈罗德橱窗内的一件新衣引起了我人注意.
sentences.en: A new dress caught my eye in Harrod's window.

sentences.en: Seaman's book caught attention of U.S. Senator Gaylord Nelson , who moved rapidly to set up hearings.

sentences.cn: 墙上不同寻常的控制板引起了我们的注意.
sentences.en: The unusual control panel on the walls caught our attention.

sentences.cn: 终于,他引起了华纳兄弟唱片公司经纪人的关注.
sentences.en: He eventually caught the attention of executives at Warner Brothers Records.

sentences.cn: 如果这能引起你的注意, 请继续读多明戈斯的书.
sentences.en: If it caught your attention, follow up by reading the Dominguez book.

sentences.cn: 我想再来一杯, 看着服务员,想引起他的注意.
sentences.en: I'd like another drink, try to catch the waiter's eye.

sentences.cn: 餐桌上的镀银调味品瓶架引起了她的注意.
sentences.en: The silver plated caster on the dining table catch her attention.

sentences.cn: 某个东西引起了他的注意.
sentences.en: Something caught his eye.

sentences.cn: 我可以告诉你，你永远别想在那里看见我。
sentences.en: You wouldn't catch me in there, I can tell you.

sentences.cn: 我不希望看见你为了出风头而去抢镜头。
sentences.en: I don't want to catch you pushing yourself into the picture to get some personal publicity...

sentences.cn: 她转过身来，看见母亲脸上迷惑的表情。
sentences.en: As she turned back she caught the puzzled look on her mother's face...

sentences.en: All at once, after an exit, he caught sight of Carrie.

sentences.cn: 他总算在远处看见了那个年轻人穿的浅色外套.
sentences.en: Finally he caught sight of the young man's light overcoat in the distance.

sentences.cn: 我忽然看见隐约地闪现着的亮光.
sentences.en: Suddenly my eyes caught the glint of a light.

sentences.cn: 思嘉看见她这副狼狈相忍不住要笑出声来, 因为瑞德抓住她的要害了.
sentences.en: Scarlett wanted to giggle at her discomfiture, for Rhett had caught her fairly.

sentences.cn: 他远远地看见有一辆车.
sentences.en: She caught sight of a car distance.

sentences.cn: 在街的一角, 我突然看见一个可怜的小男孩在行乞.
sentences.en: Suddenly , I caught sight of poor little boy begging at a street corner.

sentences.cn: 她看见一个人影儿在黑暗中消失了.
sentences.en: She caught sight of a figure disappearing into the darkness.

sentences.cn: 就在这时候他们看见了我们.
sentences.en: Just then they caught sight of us.

sentences.cn: 这家伙一看见马丁内兹,就弹簧一样向前伸出了手.
sentences.en: The man caught sight of Martinez and sprang forward hand outstretched.

sentences.cn: 于是,看不见的,看见了.
sentences.en: So catch sight of those unseen.

sentences.cn: 4我从窗户向外看去,看见了一列急驰而过的火车.
sentences.en: I looked out of the window and caught sight of a quickly passing train.

sentences.cn: 她在一家商店橱窗里看见那顶帽子,对它很是喜欢.
sentences.en: She saw the hat in a shop window and it caught her fancy.

sentences.cn: 别让我再看见你这么干!
sentences.en: Just let me catch you it again!

sentences.cn: 借着电筒光, 他看见一个人.
sentences.en: In torchlight, he caught sight of a figure.

sentences.cn: 在窃贼从银行中跑出来时,艾达蓦地看见了他.
sentences.en: Ida caught sight of the robber as he ran out of the bank.

sentences.cn: 我经常看见他释放之后,将鱼捕捉他们.
sentences.en: I often saw him release the fish after catching them.

sentences.cn: 我向西边瞧,看见云散开了一些, 有希望了!
sentences.en: I looked to the west and caught a break in the clouds. There was hope!

sentences.cn: 斯蒂芬看见靠窗有张空桌位.
sentences.en: Stephen catches sight of a table near the window.

sentences.cn: 他看见了那个女人,立刻觉得中意.
sentences.en: He saw the woman and she caught his fancy immediately.

sentences.cn: 从窗户望出去,他能看见那个湖的一小部分.
sentences.en: From the window he could catch a glimpse of the lake.

sentences.cn: 神殿的守护者应该是至少会看见一支接近的部队吧.
sentences.en: Surely an approaching airground force would have been caught by Wyrmrest Temple's defenders.

sentences.cn: 她看见商店橱窗里的一件连衣裙,立刻觉得很合心意.
sentences.en: She saw a dress in the shop window and it caught her fancy immediately.

sentences.cn: 他看见了老朋友,大叫他的名字.
sentences.en: As he caught sight of his old friend he shouted his name.

sentences.cn: 我正在街上徘徊,这时忽然看见了一家服装店.
sentences.en: I was wandering through the streets when I caught sight of a tailor's shop.

sentences.cn: 我说, 韦德, 我要是再看见你在姑姑床上胡闹, 就狠狠揍你.
sentences.en: Now , Wade, if I ever catch you on Auntee's bed again, I'll wear you out.

sentences.cn: 如今她能偶尔看见太阳在短暂地露用了, 她的兴致便飞扬起来.
sentences.en: Now that she could catch fleeting glimpses of the sun, her spirits soared.

sentences.cn: 我正在街上闲逛时,突然看见一个老朋友.
sentences.en: I was about the street when I caught sight of an old friend.

sentences.cn: 绿鳕的捕获量接近历史最高.
sentences.en: The pollack catch has stayed near record levels.

sentences.cn: 窗户上的挂钩变松了.
sentences.en: The window catch has worked loose.

sentences.cn: 那门上的挂钩断了.
sentences.en: The catch on that door is broken.

sentences.cn: 木椽子着火了。
sentences.en: The wooden rafters caught fire .

sentences.cn: 在美国,每45秒就有一所房子着火.
sentences.en: Every 45 seconds, a house catches on fire in the United States.

sentences.cn: 干木材容易着火.
sentences.en: Dry wood catches fire easily.

sentences.cn: 小姐看到一个跟土匪似的人冲进来, 然后眼睛几乎都着火了.
sentences.en: Miss saw a man with bandits as everyone else, and then come almost caught the eye.

sentences.cn: 纸着火了, 丹蹦上去踩灭了.
sentences.en: The paper caught fire, but Dan put it out by jumping on it.

sentences.cn: 在废纸篓中的纸着火.
sentences.en: The papers in the waste paper basket catch fire.

sentences.cn: 高安全性2.铁电池在挤压 、 过充、短路的情况下不会着火,即使被投入火中也不会爆炸.
sentences.en: High Safety Performance Fe battery will not catch fire under collision, over charged or short circuit.

sentences.cn: 啊! 着火了!
sentences.en: Oh! It's caught fire!

sentences.cn: 苏: 暖炉太靠近墙边了, 房间可能会着火.
sentences.en: Sue: > The heater is too close to the wall. The room might catch on fire.

sentences.cn: 洪峰到来时, 水面上的一层油膜不幸着火,把我家的房子吃水线以上部分全部烧塌.
sentences.en: As the flood crested, an oil slick caught fire and burned house down to the waterline.

sentences.cn: 维克多迟到了,他给我们编造了他所坐的火车着火的胡话.
sentences.en: Victor arrived late and told us some cock and bull story about his train catching fire.

sentences.cn: 似乎没有人知道房子是怎么着火的.
sentences.en: No one seems to know how the building caught fire.

sentences.cn: 房子相继着火了.
sentences.en: The houses caught fires one after the other.

sentences.cn: 首先窗帘着火了,之后床单也跟着燃烧起来.
sentences.en: First the curtains caught on fire and then bedclothes.

sentences.cn: 干燥期的一个失误却能引起烘干机着火.
sentences.en: A fault in the drying cycle can cause the dryer to catch fire.

sentences.cn: 今天上午8点, 乘着火车, 我们来到了杭州.
sentences.en: This morning 8:00, multiply by to catch fire a car, we at Hangzhou.

sentences.cn: 飞机着火时, 飞行员从机内弹射出来.
sentences.en: When the plane caught fire, the pilot ejected.

sentences.cn: 稻草很容易着火.
sentences.en: Straw catches fire easily.

sentences.cn: 纸一着火,火就烧得旺起来?
sentences.en: The fire flared up as the paper caught on.

sentences.cn: 当餐厅着火时, 食客们跑到了大街上.
sentences.en: When the restaurant caught fire, the diners ran into the street.

sentences.cn: 不要太靠近火炉, 你的衣服可能因此着火.
sentences.en: Don't stand too close to that stove. Your clothes may catch fire.

sentences.cn: 干草着火了, 但我们将它扑灭了.
sentences.en: The dry grass caught fire, but we beat it out.

sentences.cn: 如果目标浸油的话就会着火.
sentences.en: If target has been doused , he will also catch fire.

sentences.cn: 许多失事的飞机客舱并未受损,飞机也未着火.
sentences.en: In many crashes, the passenger cabin remained intact and the plane did not catch on fire.

sentences.cn: 干草一着,火烧得更旺.
sentences.en: The fire flared up as the dry straw caught on.

sentences.cn: 那座建筑物着火燃烧起来了.
sentences.en: The building caught fire and blazed up.

sentences.cn: 纸容易着火.
sentences.en: Paper is apt to catch fire.

sentences.cn: 另一方面, 在距离较远的地方, 只有那些容易燃烧的材料才会着火.
sentences.en: On the other hand, at greater distances , only those most easily ignitable will catch fire.

sentences.cn: 临时的炉具也很容易着火, 导致人员残废和死亡.
sentences.en: Makeshift cookers also catch fire easily, maiming and killing.

sentences.cn: 我的房子着火了.
sentences.en: My house caught fire.

sentences.cn: 明亮的黄金,而引人注目的制服颜色较深提供丰富的黄金和温暖.
sentences.en: Bright gold catches the eye while darker subdued shades of gold lend richness and warmth.

Sentence.sentence: We recently caught up with yoga entrepreneur Leah Zaccaria, who put herself through the fire of change to completely reinvent herself.
Sentence.come: 出自-2017年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Waiters, keen observers of humanity that they are, are catching on to this; in one poll, a full 30% said they didn't believe the job they did had any impact on the tips they received.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It caught us in the act, sent an alert to my smartphone, and also listed our RF interference on the system's event log.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It’s a pretty easy job, but one with lots of downtime, which means you will have  plenty of time to catch up on reading, do homework or study for an exam.
Sentence.come: 出自-2016年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Everybody sleeps, but what people stay up late to catch—or wake up early in order not to miss—varies by culture.
Sentence.come: 出自-2015年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Digital textbooks are not going to catch on," says Inkling CEO Matt Maclnnis as he's giving me a demo（演示）over coffee.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: According to the author, whether digital textbooks will catch on still remains to be seen
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The reason it hasn't caught on yet, he tells me, is that the functionality of e-edition textbooks is incredibly limited, and some students just aren't motivated to learn new study behavior.
Sentence.come: 出自-2013年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: The consequences of getting caught are serious and may include a "O" on a test or assignment, an "F" in the class, suspension (暂令停学) or dismissal from school and a ruined reputation.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Getting Away with it - Or Not Those who don't get caught pay an even higher price
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Cheating destroys self-respect and integrity, leaving the cheater ashamed, guilty and afraid of getting caught.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Worst of all, a cheater who doesn't get caught the first time usually cheats again, not only because he/she is farther behind, but also because it seems "easier
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: According to the author, a cheater who doesn't get caught right away will become more confident.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年12月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: Caught in the Web A few months ago, it wasn't unusual for 47-year-old Carla Toebe to spend 15 hours per day online
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年6月阅读原文

Sentence.sentence: It was terrible at first, especially getting up before dawn to catch that 6:30 train.
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: In the morning, I just sit in comfort and read the papers to catch up with the news
Sentence.come: 出自-2014年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Jane may be caught in a traffic jam.
Sentence.come: 出自-2011年6月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: Saddest of all is when children catch a glimpse of the masked fire fighter but hide because they think they have seen a monster.
Sentence.come: 出自-2010年12月听力原文

Sentence.sentence: It's a pretty easy job, but one with lots of downtime, which means you will have plenty of time to catch up on reading, do homework or study for an exam.
Sentence.come: 2016年12月四级真题（第一套）听力 Section C
